website_summaries.verdict: Many are pleased with the natural wood fragrance and complete biodegradability of this affordable clay alternative.
pros: Reclaimed wood formula is naturally lightweight and biodegradable
Absorbs 5 times its weight in moisture
Traps odors for up to 7 days
Safe to discard in compost bins
cons: Larger wood pellets are harder to sift and scoop than clay
Cats may not like the feel of wood on their paws

website_summaries.verdict: The biodegradable litter and compostable packaging make this product one you can feel good about using.
pros: Natural wood-based litter absorbs and locks in unpleasant scents without the use of chemicals
Produces easy-to-scoop clumps and virtually no dust
Litter is extremely lightweight, and safe to flush
Sits at a low price point
cons: Large wood pellets sometimes stick to cat's paws

customer_reviews.title: Great litter, bad seller
customer_reviews.text: The litter is very good - no chemical smell, absorbs well, clumps about 90% of the time (huge thanks to that reviewer who recommended buying a different scoop). The seller, however, is a scam. I added this litter to my Subscribe&Save orders when the large box sold for $15-something. After four deliveries I ran out of litter earlier than the scheduled delivery date and went online to order more. To my surprise I discovered that after the second delivery the price quietly went up to $23 and then to $29, and the next one would be ordered for over $30. Chewy and PetSmart, and if I remember correctly, even my local Stop&Shop sell it for less. Canceled the subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great, eco-friendly litter
customer_reviews.text: I've tried the different varieties of Okocat litters and found this one to be the best for my cat. It works well and is easy to clean. I don't like how the price keeps fluctuating. I'm hesitant to buy again knowing I bought this for much cheaper just a month ago.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: It WAS the best litter ever...
customer_reviews.text: Best clumping and the best odor control litter we have ever used, as well as being Eco friendly. It Was...Worth every penny, it did cost more but it Was ....really cheaper in the long run. BUT NOW IT IS SO OVER PRICED THAT THERE ARE MUCH LESS EXPENSIVE OPTIONS AVAILABLE. We really did love this litter but they have priced themselves out of the market.... We might start using this litter again if the price were more reasonable, but we will never pay these astronomical prices.
customer_reviews.author: THE KRELLDUDE

customer_reviews.title: Good litter but price had more than doubled in 3 months...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this litter for the first time in July 2017, for less than $15, on Amazon. I liked it a lot and went to order more in August, then it was $19. I was surprised at the increase but ordered anyway. Now it’s October and it’s almost $36?! The litter doesn’t last nearly long enough to pay that kind of price. Wow. Back to Swheat Scoop I’ll go...
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I just switched from clay to this
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I just switched from clay to this. My cat immediately used it after I changed it. She didn't mind it at all. I'm a single female who lives on the second floor of an apt building so this is MUCH easier for me to haul up the stairs. I always have to use a mask of some sort while cleaning litter (the dust bugs the crap out of me) and this is DUST FREE!!! Love the fact it's biodegradable and free of any harmful chemicals. I mixed a little of the arm and hammer litter deodorizer with it.. seems to be doing fine so far. I'll write another update in a month or so!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: dusty and WILL NEVER LEAVE YOUR HOUSE
customer_reviews.text: I've had cats for years and tried all kinds of litter. I love that this is natural, but that's all I love about it. This litter is one of the worse I've ever used. It is sooooo dusty-- think plumes and plumes! Like others have mentioned, it gets EVERYWHERE-- on the poor cats, on the furniture, on the floors-- it just tracks like there's no tomorrow. But the last straw was that in the middle of filling and scooping, the dust triggered an asthma attack (in me!)! I actually had to use my inhaler! If you do go with this litter, definitely wear a mask when refilling and scooping.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Inhaled Dust
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because it would be better for the environment than traditional clumping litter. The litter does clump very well and is easy to scoop. Odor control for urine is great, probably better for feces than I'm aware because of two of my three cats. This litter is also very lightweight. My issue is with the amount of dust. Pouring it into the litter pan some dust is expected. Consistently coughing while scooping the litter is concerning. I've noticed my kitties sneezing a bit since starting to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Oaster

customer_reviews.title: MORE THAN DOUBLE the price now - check before buying!!!
customer_reviews.text: ökocat Natural Wood Cat Litter, 19.8-Pound, Clumping]]I LOVE this product and would've given it 10 stars if possible - but not after they added <2 lbs and almost doubled the price - hence only 1 star. Check the price before reordering - it fluctuates more than any item I buy. It SHOULD cost around $17-18 instead of$34.99.. I bought an 18 lb box on June 25, 2017 for $15.97 and when I went to buy it again in February 2018 - they've added 1.8 more lbs and more than DOUBLED the price to a whopping $34.99!!! I love it - but refuse to buy it again at that price. *very sad*
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: My 2 female cats have decided this is the litter for them. Finally. Will be buying more They made a good decision. I have no litter box smell with this litter. Having 2 female felines that are totally spoiled making a good decision for our home is great. They did good with this. And they recommend this litter to all felines and their owners😘
customer_reviews.author: Chi E.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Getting pricey there...
customer_reviews.text: The large box was less than $12.50 the first purchase, $17 something the second and now over $19? While it's great on odor control, there's still bits of wood throughout my house, bed, everywhere. I appreciated the bio-degradable aspect, but for two cats it doesn't last nearly as long as advertised. The litter gets lodged in the litter mat (esp if your cat happens to miss the box) and can't be easily dislodged. Worth it for $12.50, won't be purchasing at $19.
customer_reviews.author: souleatingkitty

customer_reviews.title: Original vs. Super Soft
customer_reviews.text: I tried out both the Original and the Super Soft. Both clump well and are easy to work with. The Original is a little chunky, but my cats took to it easily enough (even though they've been used to clay or grass litters). The Original was very low dust, which I liked. Its worst flaw was that it was a little painful to step on. The Super Soft is more of a sawdust consistency, and it is SUPER dusty. Little clouds of wood dust every time I scoop the litter. I wouldn't recommend the Super Soft if your cat has asthma or other respiratory issues, like mine. I'll buy the Original again but pass on the Super Soft.
customer_reviews.author: H Clark

customer_reviews.title: Suspicious pricing.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but I'm sick of the inconsistent pricing. At one point last year the price dropped to under $10 but the quantity was restricted to one box. I needed 2 but could only order one. Less than 2 months ago I purchased a box and today I wanted to order a backup box but the price has risen over 50%. This is not acceptable. I'll be trying other brands of natural clumping litter in future.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Manley

customer_reviews.title: Something wrong with this batch I got
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this product for some time and love it because it absorbs well, clumps well and have good odor control. But this batch I brought recently is different from the Okocat I brought before. Pallets are darker, sharper and even have small, thin sharp fragment of wood in it. Smell is also different, not the natural wood scent it used to have. I am returning it because I'm afraid it may hurt my cat's paw. Bad quality control. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: The wood is pointy--cat refused to use it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an all natural litter for my cat and then normal brand he uses isn't in stores anymore so I was looking around. Do NOT use this litter. The wood chunks are pointy, and my cat wouldn't use the litter AT ALL. What ended up outside the litter box, because it gets stuck between his toes and tracks when I would put him in the litter to try and get him to try it, hurt my feet so I can only imagine how bad it hurt his little beans. Unless you'd let your cat poop on leggos, avoid this litter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, safe cat litter.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy this litter now comes in a "soft step", finer texture formulation. The original was too chunky, and tracked all over the house, but I still used it. Now that Okocat comes in a finer texture, I feel that I have the best of both worlds! Less tracking, finer grain litter, but still has superb odor control and absorbency. No artificial scents needed with Okocat.
customer_reviews.author: Marc1

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE lightweight litter. Hate clay for many reasons, including environmental. I tried to switch to a pellet system, but my 15 year old sweet boy wouldn't share his #2 there (I've heard others say that -- why so particular about poop and not pee? Weird, you kitties!). So, this Okocat litter is a bit dusty, not horrible. It does track VERY easily (and far) because it's so light and fine. But, my old boy is willing to deposit his pride and joy in it! Success! I think I might try the less fine version next (blue box). Just had to get my boy back into the litter box habit and make him happy.
customer_reviews.author: Linda ScottTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: If it weren't for the tracking..
customer_reviews.text: We've tried so many litters. Traditional clay, pellets in the Breeze system, walnut, newspaper, etc. I LOVED the clumpability of this and the cats used it. However, it tracked all over the house! I tried trimming the fur on the feet of our long haired cat and it still stuck to her. Their litter box is downstairs in the laundry room behind a closed door (they have a kitty door) and I'd find it upstairs. The mat did nothing to contain the flakes. If it weren't for the tracking I would've given it 5 stars and repurchased. Now I just never wanna see it again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Starr

customer_reviews.title: Clumps like glue.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far, the best plant based cat litter I've ever used. I was skeptically at first because of the price. I bought it because my other brand was out of stock. It clumps together like super glue. Even shaking the scooper doesn't break up clumps. No urine smell, my cats have no problems with it. I will never go back to my old brand, Swheat Scoop. This stuff totally blows it out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hitaffer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Clumping.
customer_reviews.text: The one thing I liked about this litter is that it does not have dust. It also has very good smell control. These are the pros. For cons, it tracks absolutely everywhere, I have to constantly vacuum the bathroom where my cat's litter box sits. The clumping is horrible, it breaks down and then you have little pieces of clump to remove from all over the litter box and it also sticks to the bottom of the litter box. Also, I didn't trust to flush it down my toilete more than once, because it does not dissolve at all. I really wanted to love it, but in the end I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina M. Passos

customer_reviews.title: Great Litter
customer_reviews.text: I always used World's Best Litter. I have a mouse problem and the mice really enjoyed eating the corn litter. I went hunting for a little that was still lighter than clay litter but that mice wouldn't eat. This seemed to fit the bill. The surprise came when I found it seems to work better than World's Best. It clumps nicely and it really keeps the odors down. I have switched permanently. Really good litter.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: It's like I have no litter
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a while for a good pellet litter for my 2 cats. Problems that I have come across with other brands is that you cant see the poop because the litter is too dark, it begins to smell rancid within a few days so I would have to change the litter frequently, pellets too small for the litter box or get stuck in paws. Since switching over I couldn't be happier. My cats have taken to it nicely. It clumps great, is easy to clean and doesn't smell up the litter area of urine. Plus it's flush-able and it's not a wallet killer. If you use the pellet litter box, I highly suggest this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Missy Scheer

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Impressive Cat Litter
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed at this cat litter. Tried the World's Best brand first looking for an alternative to the heavy, smelly gravelly litters I've been using. It was ok, but expensive and took the cats a while to get used to. Decided to try okocat because of the low price, not expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised to find that it worked better than the more expensive brand, AND the cats loved it. We keep the litter in a small closet, and normally the smell is very strong when you open the door, but with Okocat, no smell at all. Grateful for giving the little guy a shot! Won't be using anything else from here on out :)
customer_reviews.author: mickele hieronymus

customer_reviews.title: Cons are worse than the pros
customer_reviews.text: Tracks, tracks, tracks like crazy. It does clump well, but so do a lot of litters. The wood particles are like sharp little rocks under bare feet. We went back to World's Best mixed with Dr. Elsey's. Edit: We figured out the method of using this litter so it doesn't track and murder your feet but does clump and kill odors - with the cat(s) happy to use it. Mix with Dr. Elsey's in 50/50 ratio + add in some pine pellets. (We use Tractor Supply bedding pellets.) Still, on its own the rating of 3 stars is appropriate; ought not have to futz and fox a product for it to function as intended.
customer_reviews.author: PenroseTribar

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: So just giving you guys an update on the wood chip kitty litter I got. This stuff is absolutely AMAZING. Seriously. Its healthier for you and the fur babies because there's no dust. There's barely any traction from it unlike the clay litter that gets everywhere. When I used the clay litter, I could immediately smell when Bash (my cat) took a dump, with this stuff, theres no scent at all. Doesn't clump the best like advertised, but I clean it out every few days and I completely change out all the litter every 2 weeks, it doesn't have a weird smell either, just smells like wood. GET IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Catri King

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!  I didn't know it was like sawdust.
customer_reviews.text: This litter is just like sawdust. It's very heavy and it sticks to my kittens paws. She tracks it around the house. It hides the smell of urine, but I clean the litter daily so that might help. I won't be purchasing it again because the litter seems to deteriorate into smaller and smaller pieces that are hard to sift. However, even though I'm disappointed, I'll use up the rest of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G Morales

customer_reviews.title: Gross
customer_reviews.text: Horrible I thought it was good, but it's worse then clay. Tracks EVERYWHERE! This crap is all over my house despite having mats around and under the litter boxes. It does not disipated any of this smell. I can smell urine and feces for hours and hours after the cats have used the litter box. I clean the litter box every other day so it's not like the stuff is sitting in there for these stinking up my house. The litter clumps on to the sides and the bottom of the litter box and makes the huge disgusting mess. It is lightweight. That's why I gave it a star
customer_reviews.author: roadfamily6now

customer_reviews.title: Best litter ever!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this litter! I have 3 cats and this is our first time trying an eco friendly litter (Arm&Hammer clumping was always my go to) and I’ll never go back!! The smell of the wood chips is FANTASTIC and the absorbency is great! The only negative thing I have to say is that it doesn’t hide the poop odor. We have 3 cats and I scoop it every day, but if I miss a day or two it’s never a big deal! The urine odor stays contained. The tracking is minimal, but it does hurt when you step on it. Overall we love this litter and will continue to purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Caylen

customer_reviews.title: A little harder to clean, but a good alternative to clay.
customer_reviews.text: This smells great, like fresh cut wood. But know that it is not "scented". While cleaning you smell the waste you are cleaning but when buried, the litter box contains the scent. Ours is in the basement so I can't rate this for living space use, but we detected no smell when playing pool in the basement. It has good absorbency, but is a bit tougher to clean (as seen in the video). Definitely need to get a large hole scooper! Otherwise it is a great alternative to heavy, dusty, and wasteful clay based litter.
customer_reviews.author: Raive

customer_reviews.title: Tracking is an understatement
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of Okocat long hair, but it’s frequently unavailable. Decided to give this version a whirl, and although it clumps well and has good odor control, the tracking is absolutely ridiculous. It’s so fine, that it sticks in the crevasses of their paws—then when they play, jump, or otherwise use their paws, the litter dislodges and leaves a spray of sawdust EVERYWHERE! I could never have imagined the mess, but here I am with dark wood floors, constantly vacuuming! We’ve never had any trouble with the long har version of Okocat, (aside from the box getting destroyed during shipping), but this version is the pits.
customer_reviews.author: JRYo

customer_reviews.title: Worst litter
customer_reviews.text: Just a horrible litter. I typically get Worlds Best Cat Litter which the cats love but this was on sale so gave it a go. Reasons for it being bad #1, It doesn't keep the smells away at all. It stinks the entire apartment up, even after cleaning it efficiently. #2, it makes a mess. The wood gets everywhere, and sticks to the cats paws. #3, it attracts gnats. Everytime i clean the box its FULL of gnats just in the litter, its disgusting. Never seen this before with a litter.
customer_reviews.author: Chris94

customer_reviews.title: Changed their product... not good anymore.
customer_reviews.text: They have changed their litter! I had been using this litter for about a year and it had been great, the texture was like small wood chunks that absorbed well and were manageable for a longer period of time. However, with my last shipment it was an entirely different color and texture. It was a dark dirt like texture similar to what I’d imagine you’d find as bedding for a rodents cage. It was gross and did not have the same qualities as before. I am no longer a fan and will be cancelling my future auto shipments.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlynn

customer_reviews.title: Not the same litter
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this product 5 times from Amazon as well as from a local pet store for a family of 3 cats having switched from a pine brand. I thought this litter was amazing. This batch is totally not. There is zero odor control and there's no point in discussing anything else from there. I thought I made a mistake and ordered the wrong kind but my order is the same as every other time--it's the product that is different.
customer_reviews.author: SandyToes

customer_reviews.title: I don't RECOMEND
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping that the trail of cat litter would end. Big mistake!!! The trail was as bad as the other ones, but now I had huge wood pallets all over, even on top of my bed and on tables. Just all over. I dont even know how. Its a good absorbing the smell. It's easy cleaning. But, I think it caused my cat some urinary problems. I switched back to the old cat litter and hoping he gets better, otherwise, a vet visit and God Knows how much to treat. So I DON'T RECOMEND IT!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Wanted a low dust litter spent days looking at litters from the crystals to the corn litters and everything in between. Came in a huge box and seems to be working well. Seems to be absorbing odors really well and our cat didnt mind the switch at all. Doesnt get stuck to her feet as much as litter which means less mess outside of her box!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Shocked that I love this!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this litter expecting it to be a one off due to some degree of ineffectiveness. I cannot recommend this litter enough. Smells fresher far longer than clay litter and performs better on absorbency. My cat loved it and needed no adjustment period. There is much less tracking, however there is still some. Easy to scoop and the frequency of changing is a fraction of what we had to do with clay litter. From once every 1-2 weeks to ever 3-5 weeks. Saves money and feels good to not contribute to landfill sludge.
customer_reviews.author: mlssa

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this, and I'm amazed at how quickly my two older kitties took to it. As other reviewers have noted, this litter has larger particles than most, so you might need a new scoop -- TOTALLY worth it. The great benefit of the larger particles is they do better at actually staying in the litter box. Sure, some still escapes (I think that's inevitable) but it's much, much better and for those of us who share out bathrooms with our kitties. Odor control is very good without any nasty perfumes, plus I'm so glad to have a litter that's better for the envirnoment.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A. Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Terrible tracking
customer_reviews.text: We're going to have to pass on this one. The horrible tracking from this litter is intolerable. It absorbs just fine and I didn't notice much odor, though my husband did complain. We had 2 kittens use this litter for less than a week. We cleaned it multiple times a day. We had to keep a broom right next to the box to keep the tracked litter in check. This litter is just too much work. Pass pass passedy pass.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Tinker

customer_reviews.title: Favorite so far
customer_reviews.text: I tried different litters. But since I got this I found that I didn't want to change it. It tracks and has saw dust but I haven't found a litter that doesn't do it yet. Saw dust is not so annoying as silicone, or walnut, or corn dust. The smell of wood is pleasant. The litter doesn't really absorb smells but once you remove excrements it stops smelling, and it doesn't start for 3-4 weeks (in comparison to corn or walnut). The only one concern is carcinogenic properties of the saw dust (as written on the box). It's not known if it's dangerous for pets and owner when used as litter.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Love it. No odor, easy clump removal (but never flush)
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the product for 2 months now, but still mixed with a bit of clumping clay litter. So far, I love it!! No more concrete stuck to the bottom. Love how lightweight it is. Controls odor extremely well. My first box was the coarse grind-that tracked more with my two cats than the super soft. I like the super soft better. My only reason for not giving it a five is that NOTHING should say flushable except toilet paper. I plan to comment to the seller on that point. Price on Amazon keeps it affordable.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bray

customer_reviews.title: No more subscribe and saving anything from amazon
customer_reviews.text: STAY AWAY FROM SUBSCRIBING THIS ITEM: Amazon has increased my subscribe and save with this item, started at $13 a box, 3 boxes per 3 weeks. Last order apparently went through for $17 per box, now this latest order tried to come through for $19.99 a box...I cancelled my subscription.. ridiculous. Amazon doesn’t have to tell you when they INCREASE your “subscribe and save” cost.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Masterson

customer_reviews.title: Much lower dust than others and my cat doesn't eat it!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried just about every flushable litter out there--litter made from corn, wheat, walnut shells, etc. This is by far the best I've tried. Most importantly, my cat doesn't eat it. My cat always ate the corn and wheat litters, and she even ate the walnut shell litters. These would all make her sick. Finally, this litter she doesn't eat. It clumps great and flushes down the toilet. As with any litter like this, you only want to flush one clump at a time. This has far less dust and tracking than all the other litters I've tried. It's also cheaper than most of the other flushable litters.
customer_reviews.author: BASS!

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you're a clean freak
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but it doesn't work. When I first got it, I was surprised how soft it was for my cats. I thought that was a plus. However, after using it for almost a month, it has been the worst litter. I've used all kinds to try and find the right fit for my cats. They seemed to like it but it definitely doesn't do anything about odor. You smell everything! All the time. It also gets EVERYWHERE. I have litter mats to try and minimize the tracking but it does nothing. Because the chips are so fine, it sticks to my cats with electricity or something. It's in my bed, on my couch and all over my floors.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Supersoft is not the same material
customer_reviews.text: The photo shows the two different materials. The light, natural wood color is the original, the darker greenish one is what arrived with my recent order. EXTREMELY dusty! And the texture appears to be hay rather than wood. Does not absorb well. Urine clumps break down when you try to scoop it instead of staying in a nice clump. Would like to contact the manufacturer and find out if this is an error, or if they actually changed the product without disclosing that. They mention the box may look different (it didn't) but not the actual product. Hope I don't have to find a new brand. Very disappointed. (Amazon customer service was great. Will still buy litter through Amazon!)
customer_reviews.author: S. Parker

customer_reviews.title: the best litter in the world no lie! We own caracal to sphynx
customer_reviews.text: Ive gone thru a lot of litter in 30 years so I mean it when I say this is one of the best out there. Its box last forever and its easy to clean without smell. Its great for planet I live in Florida toss mines outside in our woods. I have issues with our main coon and Siamese they both love this litter and only share one big big box without issues.Our sphynx kittens both love it and put friends serval n caracal cat even love it! The blast brand you will every try !
customer_reviews.author: Meadow Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Best eco-friendly litter!
customer_reviews.text: Thumbs up to Okokat that is truly making effort to be GREEN. This is the only brand I know of that don't use so much plastic packaging. The box is made of cardboard. The price is fine for such a large size box. As for the litter itself, I'll just refer you to Em's review dated August 16, 2014. I completely agree with the super thorough review and all the things there still stand today, except for the pricing which is currently the lowest on Amazon and it is delivered to our door. Definitely recommend especially for those who care about the environment. There is the soft on paws version that is also great. It's a matter of personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Sainte Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Clumps Very Well
customer_reviews.text: Longhair Version. Clumps very well and quite quickly. Smells wonderful. I sadly stopped using it because it tracked too much for me! I work from home now and can scoop the box throughout the day, yet I still found this to track more than normal pine pellets. I decided that this would be a good option for cat sitters compared to pine pellets due to scoopable bonus of this product, but I will sadly not use it as my regular litter. That said, I think it is at least worth a try, especially if your cat box is in a more remote location where tracking cannot make it far into living areas of a house.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to dispose, cats preferred it
customer_reviews.text: Only slight negative is that the litter doesn't flow through the scoop slots quite as quickly; really have to jiggle it about. Didn't like throwing all the old litter away; this I toss in the yard. Suggest mixing with the clay at first to transition your cats, otherwise they might disapprove, which is not fun. Have 3 boxes for 2 cats; left one with clay, stepped the other two up on wood. Eventually they weren't using the clay anymore, so they obviously prefer the wood too.
customer_reviews.author: Great Land Ape

customer_reviews.title: All natural and really works for my cat and I!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the clay, walnut shell and corn-based litters. For the walnut shells and corn, my can just stopped using her box. The minute I switched to okocat she started consistently using her litter box again. Urine really does clump nicely in this so it's easy to clean, clumps don't disintegrate or fall apart like the walnut shells did and box is not smelling at all. The litter has a natural light wood scent which is pleasant. I bought an 11 inch stainless steamer tray and am using that for the box with this litter so there's nothing for yucky odors to cling to. I definitely recommend this litter.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this litter to the other natural brands. I cannot stand clay litter! This litter has minimal dust and controls odor well. It has no scent other than wood. I noticed that other natural litters, like corn and wheat, would get an odd smell even though they had no scent. I like that this is lightweight and my cats have no problem with the litter. The only major annoyance is the tracking. It gets everywhere and requires extra effort daily to keep my home clean. However, it seems that all lightweight litters track, in my experience. There really is no perfect litter, but for me, this brand has more positives than negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Christina16

customer_reviews.title: Messy messy, but decent litter!
customer_reviews.text: I use to be a big fan of feline pine until it was bought out by Arm & Hammer. So I have been looking for a replacement. The pros of this litter-odor control and lightweight. The cons-clumping could be better and THE MESS! I have never had such messy tracking litter. It seems to be everywhere! Big pieces of wood, too! I do miss the feline pine smell and thought maybe this would smell somewhat like that, but it didn’t. However, it worked great on odor control.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great in every way except possible wood crumbs on furniture
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about this litter: it’s absorbing, clumping, absorbs smells better than most litters, and smells like wood. I got the “regular” texture. I have the litter box sitting on a mat that is supposed to collect all the crumbs from the cat’s paws. But, occasionally I still find sharp wood crumbs around the house or on my bed. I guess no litter is perfect. But this one is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Screw the clay litter! This is the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite cat litter. I hate litter dust and my older cat peed a lot! It clumps great! If you also have a cat like mine who doesn't cover their sh*t, this litter still somehow managed to take hide that smell with it barely covered. You will need a scoop with bigger holes. Which was like a couple bucks on Amazon. This litter along with the litter genie is my life saver! No dust no nasty clay dust smell or kitty poop smell. If your kitty has bladder issues it will also be really easy to see if they have blood in their urine. I will never go back to clay!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: This litter is a game changer for me, going from clumping clay dusty cat litter to this was drastic but after nearly 30 days I am making this my go to litter. The litter clumps great, the smell is held better than a normal clay litter, not near as much as a mess and there’s no dust. The only flaw was when cleaning my litter box I have a normal sized scoop and it isn’t big enough to sift like I would like it to because it’s a light litter so it doesn’t fall through as fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstin Folk

customer_reviews.title: I like the brand but not this variety of pellets.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this brand however I don't like this type of pellet. The other type of pellets and granulated variety of this brand absorbs then breaks up and the cleanly dumps out of the box. This variety almost gels up or something and makes these huge mountains of urine that adheres to the bottom of the tray. I've had to scrape it out every single time!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly B

customer_reviews.title: Good litter, but needs improvement in one key area
customer_reviews.text: This cat litter has so much potential. I really like that it is so lightweight, and the odor control is great! The fact it is compostable is a huge plus! The problem I have with it....and it is a dealbreaker....the litter doesn't come off the paws right away. It travels right past the normally effective litterpad I have installed outside the litterbox, and makes it's way through the entire house (and we have a big house). I'm finding litter everywhere....even in the kitchen, which is on a different floor and a long way from the litterbox! If they redesign this litter so it's not so sticky, I'll give it a try again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mandie

customer_reviews.title: Best all around litter.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best, no strong smell, long lasting, easy to clean cat litter I have found. Our cats are two years old and one has a sneezing problem. The clay litter is dusty while this litter is not. I put the cat waste in a plastic bucket with a lid. I empty it every 10 days because there is very little waste. I still get some small bits of litter on the matt in front of the litter box but it was worse with clay and other litters I tried. Small price to pay for no order, less waste, and it has a light wood smell when you put it in the litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Great clay litter replacement
customer_reviews.text: This litter is fantastic! It smells like wood so its not got a heavy artificial scent (scents really bother me and frequently give me a headache). The woody scent completely neutralizes odors and we have had guests tell us they didn't know the litter box was in the room we were in because it doesn't smell like kitty waste (perfect!!). We love that its not dangerous for our kitty either with artificial scents and it doesn't create any dust (also great for headache reduction!). We have purchased this several times and will continue to do so!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Copenhaver

customer_reviews.text: This is the best cat litter I have ever purchased, hands down. I have asthma and can’t use a lot of litters because of the dust they create. I also find that my cat simply refuses to use the box if it has a litter he doesn’t like the smell of. Neither of these are problems with this litter - it smells like fresh lumber, and it clumps like a dream!
customer_reviews.author: Butterbee28

customer_reviews.title: GREAT litter but very messy tracking....
customer_reviews.text: My family and I have had three cats over the years including our new kitten we recently adopted. Of all the cat litters we’ve ever used, this one is probably the best we’ve tried. I like that it’s made from a natural, sustainable source (wood) and it is biodegradable and flushable. It clumps magnificently, and as long as you scoop it every day, controls odor better than anything we’ve used in the past. However, the super soft version tracks very bad. We use a mat by the litter box that catches a lot of it but it still gets everywhere and requires daily vacuuming. Even so, we don’t mind the trade off and will continue to use this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Lilah G.

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite litter
customer_reviews.text: Sawdust is an environmental choice. We can dump it in the compost once a month and not burden the landfill with clay and cat poop💩. This brand of litter doesn't poof a lot of dust into the air, which is good for both the cat and me. The soft step sifts a bit easier than the crushed pellets or the whole pellets. Our cat likes it okay as well. We sift twice a day and change it every month and never have any odor problem. We also like that it comes in a box except that they often leak in shipping. I don't like plastic bags, but a paper bag would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate that this cat litter is natural. I've been experimenting with natural litters and I'd much rather use World's Best cat litter, which is a lot better in many ways. This okocat litter gets EVERYWHERE in my large apartment. I have two mats by the litter box to help with tracking, but that does nothing for this brand. Also the smell is really bad after a couple days, you really have to make sure you're scooping twice a day to make the smell somewhat manageable. it doesn't help with the ammonia smell. World's best cat litter does a way better job at this.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: doesn't make much dust. Inexpensive, lasts about a month for 2 litter boxes. Doesn't track as much as clay. My cats don't seem to sneeze as much since I switched. Cons: doesn't do much for odor. Is sticky & difficult to clean off bottom. Clumps tend to fall apart. All in all it's okay. I don't love it or hate it. Clay litter puts off too much dust and bothers my asthma, tracks everywhere, and is heavy, so I needed an alternative. It's cheaper than other alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Nan from Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Okocat Natural wood Litter
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a different wood litter that was made from Hinoki wood and Green Tea. I've been very pleased with it, but I saw Okocat and thought it sounded and looked similar for less money. It does not come close to working as well. It tracks really bad--the other barely tracked. It had absolutely ZERO odor control no matter how clean I kept the pan. I never smelled the pans with the other. And it doesn't really clump--maybe semi clump so tends to fall apart and be a bit messy when scooping. I will be going back to the more expensive one in the pink and white bag--you get what you pay for .
customer_reviews.author: Celticreds5

customer_reviews.title: BEST. LITTER. EVER !!! (And my cat agrees)
customer_reviews.text: Flushable. Lasts 2 weeks longer then clay litter. Unscented (which my cat prefers). Super Soft for happy Paws. Clumping. Uh did I mention... FLUSHABLE?!!?!! Ever since switching my cat has been happier, with less Uretic problems (which she’s prone too) and went from using two separate litter boxes- one to pee in. One to poop in. Which she decided to start using two different ones when she got her first UTI a year and a half ago and stopped peeing in a litter box all together and would only go on towels, bath mats, or the floor itself- to only using one again!!!! We’re so happy to be an ökocat Family
customer_reviews.author: Brynn

customer_reviews.title: Best cat litter ever!
customer_reviews.text: Finally the perfect cat litter ever!!! I'm coming from Europe where I used to buy Cat's Best Original okoplus (i'm still wondering why they are not selling in the USA as they sell in Canada). This one is pretty similar and works really great!! After trying (and being disappointed) World's best and Sweat Scoop, I finally found the perfect solution with my Okocat! Amazing odor control, clumping perfectly and lasting really long! I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: The tracking of litter is bad!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Day #1: I am not impressed with the tracking. It is aweful. Unfortunately it’s not limited to the picture. It tracks everywhere! I found a couple pieces on the back of my couch that must have been stuck to my cat. I will say the odor control is pretty impressive though. I cannot smell the litter box when I walk in the bathroom. I don’t see me continuing to use this litter because of the tracking though. I’ll update soon. Update: I didn’t make it a second day! I am done with this litter. The tracking and now smell is terrible! Fresh step extreme it is!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashton02

customer_reviews.title: Please try it! See for yourself
customer_reviews.text: Best so far. There's barely any trail, so little of it that combined with the mat and this litter box, there's really never much litter on my actual floor...maybe just 1 or 2 little pellets only if a week goes by before I clean the area. Smells really good but the scent dies off as the cat uses it of course. Overall extremely happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kae S.

customer_reviews.title: How Does Anyone Like This Stuff??
customer_reviews.text: Barely forms clumps. Odor control not nearly as good as Dr. Elseys litter in my opinion. Has a strong woody smell, I prefer not to smell anything. Short hair cat tracks this ALL OVER my house! Its awful!!! Ended up throwing all of it out, unusable and disgusting having litter everywhere in my house. Only thing I liked was that it was natural and seems healthier for cats maybe but definitely not worth the MESS. I only tried this pink box version, maybe the others are better? Not worth the risk for me.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product.  Recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.text: We really like this cat litter. It doesn't track. The cats all use it - seamless transition from clay litter to this wood litter. I was looking for something I could compost outside that wouldn't make a goopy mess. This is excellent. We change the box about once a month and there is no odor - we don't even scoop. (Cats also go outside about half the time.)
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great litter. No more dust and yuk in my cats paws.
customer_reviews.text: I love this cat litter and can’t believe I used Scoop Away so long!! All the dust ! This litter clumps and keeps the smell away. It’s lightweight and lasts way longer than clay. Lol I hear our cat Louie in it right now!! He adapted immediately. It’s like you are just removing the waste, not a clumped pile. One thing I did not like is that I bought the large box for a great price. Now they only have it in smaller box for more money. What’s up Amazon? I’ve been a customer for 10 years. This happens a lot. Try it. I’m sure you will wonder why it took so long to change as well.
customer_reviews.author: Maria T.

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I had to go to a regular litter box after my litter robot died and I haven't been able to replace yet, needed some more litter and decided to try this out. Maybe it is because I have used regular litter for so many years both in a box and in the LR but just not a fan of this. Pluses, my new kitty uses it and it does not track out of the box but it just does not seem to clump ashard as the regular clumping litters do, think a simi-soggy lump of rice krispies. Going back to reordering regular litter.
customer_reviews.author: vicki andrew

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had any luck with cat litter - I’ve tried clay, pellets, special litter boxes - so I was wary of this brand. But I’ve never been more positively surprised. I can’t even begin to tell you how much this works better than anything I’ve tried before. I smells sort of barn like when really bad, but that is nothing compared to the smell of chemically strong urine (I did grow up on a farm, so the smell is super normal). It clumps so easily and contains the urine in small areas and it’s so much easier to clean because the consistency is lighter and chunkier than clay. I also clean it much less frequently.
customer_reviews.author: ModernArtisan

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It is okay. Certainly better than some of the questionable litter products out there. I felt good knowing that my long haired Siberians weren't going to get any clumping particles stuck in their fur or sensitive kitty parts. They did drag out a ton of litter though... but I won't hold it against okocat that my cats are slobs. I ended up using Pretty Litter after trying out okocat for a few months and am still using Pretty Litter.
customer_reviews.author: TLynnTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a step up from regular litter. Hard to swallow the price though
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is so much better than the regular junk you buy at the supermarket. Hides pee smell better, doesn't stick to cat's paws as much, lasts longer in litter box, and of course is made from recycled wood/paper product. Cat likes it, but that doesn't mean anything because she's not picky. This litter is really expensive, but it does last about twice as long as regular clay based litters, so the financial impact isn't necessarily as dramatic as you'd think. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: CameramanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Best litter
customer_reviews.text: This is the best litter I have tried so far. It controls odors, clumps nicely is easy to clean and lasts a long time. The product is mentioned to be flush-able but we have been composting it. I have tried walnut shell and wheat and my cats ate both litters. The yesterdays news was messy and the cats didn't like it. I was trying to avoid clay litter as they have so much dust. It's my favorite litter product by far.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sold on this litter. It has a slight scent of wood, but absorbs other smells. It clumps just enough to scoop, but no more kitty pan cement. One pan fill lasts longer than clay, & the pan is EZ to clean. The pellets do scatter a little, but a mat takes on most of it. Most importantly, Max likes it.
customer_reviews.author: esd.

customer_reviews.title: Love the litter not the packaging
customer_reviews.text: WORST EVER DELIVERY. Thisast delivery was absolutely ridiculous!!! It BARELY had any litter in it and because of this stupid covid there was noonw to speak to! Seriously Amazon??? You can't have CS at home like Walmart??? I will give you this LAST chance but I have little doubt you'll amaze me. Walmart will be better especially because I can actually talk to a live person!!! EVERYTIME there is something wrong with the box. It's damaged or glued way beyond necessary smh get it together factory. For what you charge there should not be ANY problems smh
customer_reviews.author: Spanish Hick

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I like this brand. Have used the one with the blue band on the box as well. I prefer this one and with each I combine with a corn litter. Seems more the consistency of clay litter that way. This one makes more of a mess however and gave 4 stars because of the price. Quite a bit more when it's only been shaved to smaller pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra D.

customer_reviews.title: Subpar Litter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try to help an elderly cat who has developed some litter box avoidance issues. It didn't help at all. That issue aside, while I appreciate that this is an all-natural product, it does not clump well, creates a lot of dust when pouring, and tracks horribly--I have sawdust all over the floors and in every corner now. I've used a number of different litters over the decades, and this is one of the poorer ones I've tried. My go-to is now Dr. Elsey's clay litter, which my other cats have no issue with, clumps extremely well, and makes very little mess.
customer_reviews.author: Panzermann

customer_reviews.title: The one!
customer_reviews.text: The ultimate litter. Absolutely no odor, no dust. After weeks of replenishing over the same litter without completely replacing it still smells like cedar shavings. Another thing I noticed it basically bleached the inner litter box stained for years by Naturally Fresh walnut litter. I briefly switched to World’s Best before switching to Ökocat and stopped mid bag. This is the winner on all fronts. Price, Odor control, Dust, tracking. My cat loves it too and it didn’t even take Sasha 5 min to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Murad Afandiyev

customer_reviews.title: I love this junk
customer_reviews.text: Hey quick warning if you, like I was, are stupid, and think your cat who hasn’t ever used pellets before will just use pellets if you switch them immediately: they won’t use the litter box. You have to slowly add the pellet litter over time and get them used to it. My own mistake aside, this stuff rocks. It smells wonderful, clumps well, and is great for my stupid idiot longhair child who kept getting clay everywhere. I recommend the switch. It’s supposedly flushable as well, but I haven’t tried that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Clark

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Dust
customer_reviews.text: I suppose it should be obvious due to the fact that this particular litter is slightly larger than sawdust but it is entirely too dusty. I received two boxes, two days ago, filled the boxes on the day they were received and will be replacing the litter tomorrow. It clumps fairly well and it seems to do an ok job of hiding the odors. It tracks poorly but I think that sort of thing also depends on other factors. My sinuses can't handle the absurd amount of dust from simply maintaining the litter boxes and I would prefer not to subject my cats to it either. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: NickHNC

customer_reviews.title: Stops stinky poops
customer_reviews.text: My young male cat is particularly stinky. He poisons the air in my apartment and sometimes he wakes me up in the night with the smell. There’s nothing wrong with him, he’s just kinda gross. This is the only litter that’s stopped the smell. I’ve tried arm and hammer, prettylitter, fresh step, scoop away, swheat scoop, but this is hands down the best. It tracks a little more than I’d like, but the pieces are big so you can either grab them by hand or sweep them super easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Finally peeing in the litter box!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has refused to go pee in the litter box for the last five years. I have tried every litter out there. This is the first litter that she will go to the bathroom in the litter box. It is a little messy and tracks around. For me that’s not a big deal because the litter box is in the basement. I also use another litter because she has never once pooped in this box. But I am so happy that she has found a litter that she will Pee in. For that I give it five stars!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J and P

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Pricing could be more stable.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I first saw it at a local pet store, then saw it online for a little less. I bought the 19.8 lbs box from Amazon last month for $17.72. I wanted to buy again but saw the same 19.8 lbs version but listed at $30! Today, it's at $26. How's the price testing going? I'm sure I'm not the only one who has noticed. I would give it 5 stars if the pricing was back to $18.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best with a big "but"
customer_reviews.text: This litter controls odor so well, and clumps amazingly. I used it for two weeks and it still smelled like fresh cut wood on the 14th day. Unfortunately it tracks everywhere. Everywhere! I was finding it on the couch, the dining room table, and the boxes are on the other side of the house. I have seven cats, so it may be a great litter for a one or two cat household but I couldn't take the mess anymore. The good news is that the blue box Okocat is just as good and tracking stays confined to the kitty room due to the larger pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Rabbits!
customer_reviews.text: For those of you who have pet rabbits and have experienced the STRUGGLE to find the right litter, you know exactly what I'm talking about. Okocat is affordable AND safe for my two rabbits, plus it's much easier to scoop than other wood litter or paper pellets. Also more absorbent. I was using Weruva's Tea Potty, which I love but can no longer afford. Okocat is now my go-to rabbit litter and has seriously saved the day in my house. So far we are on day 5 of regular scooping/adding new litter in. No odor, no need to change the whole litter box. I may update after a longer period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this 'litter' for almost two years now and it is amazing. Being able to just scoop and dump in the toilet has saved so much time and energy. It lasts for such a long time also, so it's no different than buying regular cat litter price-wise. Just likr with regular litter it gets tracked on the floor, but instead of tint chunks of clay that can hurt your bare feet if you step on them, it's tiny, soft pieces of wood that don't hurt at all. Bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Dani-L

customer_reviews.title: Get a good litter mat!
customer_reviews.text: Litter is super light, we use it with the. The little clumps nicely, doesn't have that disgusting scented or clay litter smell, and keeps box odors down to a minimum. The only downside is that the litter is so light, the cats frequently fling it out of the box. Make sure you have a good litter mat or you're going to have this stuff all over your house.
customer_reviews.author: Meggalicious

customer_reviews.title: Tracks more than a GPS...
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Odor control was amazing! We switched abruptly from World’s Best and cat didn’t seem to mind. Neutral: Scooping was very different from smaller grained litters (more like picking up clumps with a scoop than actual sifting) Con: this litter tracks like NONE OTHER. Yikes yikes yikes...litter all through the entire house, even with daily sweeping. MAYBE if the box were in a basement this could work, but that’s not our set up and we won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rickey R.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Cats won't use it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to find a litter to replace Fresh Results corncob litter which had no scent (one of my boys has allergies) and is fine enough for my declawed girl (I got her that way :( ) with nothing even coming close. I hoped Okocat would do it, but it's too coarse for Smokey and the 3 boys won't use it. Every few days I do find one clump of pee, but that's it. It also doesn't go through any of the 3 different litter scoops I have without having to vigorously shake the scoop. I can't weigh in on oder control but there is no perfumy scent. I'll use it in the garden as mulch.
customer_reviews.author: Kris M, Millville, PA

customer_reviews.title: Best Litter Yet
customer_reviews.text: My cat was scared to use this but once he got used to it it's been a GREAT... There's been a lot less tracking from his paws and so easy to vacuum and clean up. I haven't notice any pee or poop smell. I bought this because there was no more Abound litter at the store I'm glad I did - this is a better product.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Great litter
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 cats and have been on the hunt for the perfect litter for years. While this litter isn’t perfect, it has a lot more pros than cons. I like that it doesn’t have a glade plug in type smell, doesn’t clump like concrete, is relatively low dust, absorbs pee pretty well, lasts longer, is fairly priced, and is better for the environment. The only negative is that it’s harder to scoop because the litter is thicker. This isn’t as big of a deal for me but annoys my wife when she has to scoop. We’ve been using this litter for 6+ months.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Not dust free at all
customer_reviews.text: It says 99% dust free but i see dust all over my furniture when the 99% dust free litter i have been using forever never did this. And i have only bee using it a month. I was hoping it would work because it is great for not tracking very much. I am using the pellets for long hair cats. The dust free is a major thing for me so very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: BRIDGET R GUY

customer_reviews.title: Great for Man cats
customer_reviews.text: I have a man cat. I tried grass litter which he ate.... then this litter to try and get away from the environmental unfriendly and unhealthy clay litters. This stuff is amazing, it clumps well, is light weight, smells like wood chips and completely has removed his odors from the house. We used to have stinky poo and ammonia urine smells, but not anymore. It’s not had any pest or mold issues. It’s a little dustier than I prefer but it’s less dusty than clay low dust litters.
customer_reviews.author: Phaonis

customer_reviews.title: Not dust free by any means....
customer_reviews.text: I like this litter but part of why I paid $19 a case is because it states it's dust free. It's far from dust free. It's almost more dusty than clay litter. The dust is now just yellow and not gray :). Also, this gets tracked a lot farther than clay litter. The wood grains stick in their paws a lot better (rougher texture than clay) so I find myself sweeping a lot. I might try their longer pellet stuff to really see if we can minimize the dust.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie C.

customer_reviews.title: Finally, everything I've ever wanted in a cat litter
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying this product because I'd tried wood based litters before, ones that claimed to clump and ones that didn't, and even my sister scoffed that wood based litters are "gross...never buy them". But I've been searching for a dust free alternative to clay litters, I struck out with the new blue crystal litters, and decided to give this one a shot. I just scooped the box with this litter for the first time and I'm blown away. It clumped perfectly, there was no overwhelming scent of ammonia (only a nice woody fragrance), and the loose pellets fell easy through my scooper. This one is going on my subscribe & save, and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: solitary_dragon

customer_reviews.title: No more clay dust inhalation!
customer_reviews.text: Saved me & my kittens from inhaling clay litter dust. My 3 month old kittens switched to this supersoft litter cold turkey (which was a risk, I know) but I think they hated the scented, arm & hammer clay litter I had before anyway. The #2 odor is very noticeable, which is fine for me as I need to monitor their passings at this age and I scoop it up within 5-10 minutes. The tracking is better than clay, altho my black boy gets a bit of wood dust on his coat now and again.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne C.

customer_reviews.title: Flushable there's no smell at all it gets a little messy so I just put a rug under her box
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March I have one cat she weighs 9 lb she eats normal and drinks normal and I still have a little less than half of the box left it is the end of May I love this stuff I will never buy anything other than it ever again I forget to empty the box because there is no smell and I'm in a room that's right around 200 square feet so it's kind of small not one time have I smelled the box I need them gone for days without cleaning it I recommend this one hundred percent
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Store-Bought Dusty Litter
customer_reviews.text: Really love this product. Our tracing with regular litters got really bad after we adopted our tabby kitten. I started asking around for better litters and the tracing has been cut 75%. Before, I was cleaning the litter room every day, now it’s once a week! I paired it with a large holed mat and the frequently bought scoop. The litter is lighter, too, and No dust! My kitties took to it after I mixed it with their old litter for a week and now we’re on straight Oko Cat litter.
customer_reviews.author: KStewart

product_meta.title: ökocat Natural Wood Clumping Cat Litter (Package may vary)
